Multimodal Power Outage Prediction for Rapid Disaster Response and Resource Allocation

Alejandro Aparcedo, Christian Lopez, Abhinav Kotta , Mengjie Li
University of Central Florida
52nd Photovoltaic Specialists Conference
Code arXiv

Introduction

We present a novel visual spatiotemporal framework for predicting power outage severity and location from nighttime satellite imagery. Utilizing satellite imagery from NASA's Black Marble product suite, we developed a Visual-Spatiotemporal Graph Neural Network (VST-GNN) to learn spatial and temporal coherence from images. Our approach combines visual feature extraction with graph-based modeling to capture the complex dynamics of power infrastructure disruptions during extreme weather events.
